When you look up in the sky and see many dark "clouds," it might mean that rain is coming soon. Rain comes from clouds. Clouds are actually made from rain that has not fallen yet.
Rain is what we call water that falls from the sky. Rain is just like the water that we drink every day.
These are raindrops sitting on a leaf. The rain that falls from the sky is made from many of these tiny raindrops.
Rain is very important for our earth and the plants that live here. Just like "humans," plants must drink water to survive.

Sometimes it rains too "much," and the water fills up the ground. We call this a flood. When it "floods," it might seem like there is a lake or a river where it does not belong. Floods can be "dangerous," so be careful.
